parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
(Hebrew), Lot, nephew of Abraham. Of Hebrew origin; Lot, a patriarch.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To plant, set. From a derivative of phuo; to set out in the earth, i.e. Implant; figuratively, to instil doctrine.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
